li.a: Cypress Trails Childcare Center, East Spring

p.span: The SHSU Charter School community must work together to fight COVID-19. Head to http://tea.texas.gov/staywell for vitally important public health guidance to stop the spread. If we stand apart as a community now, we will be together again soon.

li.span: Did you know that washing your hands with soap & water eliminates #Coronavirus molecules preventing the virus from infecting you & others? The same is true when you disinfect surfaces. Science says it works.https://bit.ly/2w7TGAJ #COVID19 #txed #StayWellTexas

img.style: display: block; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;

span.strong: Governor Abbott extended his Executive Order through May 4, 2020. As part of this order all school facilities in Texas must remain closed. Due to this extension of his order, the SHSU Charter School will continue our remote learning platforms.

span.em: "If you have any questions or concerns, please do not hesitate to contact my office."

strong.span: We are SO PROUD of the hard work our staff and students are putting in to "remote learning"! Keep up the great work, everyone!

a.data-alt: large view of Case_Home Grocery Shopping List Making - Copy (3)

p.span: Charter School Campus Leaders met with Dr. Knox and Dr. O'Neal during spring break to prepare for our remote learning programs to begin on March 24. We are excited to "see" our students again!
Enrollment for the 2020-2021 school year is now OPEN! Please complete the 2020-2021 Enrollment Application and submit to Joseph Mesa at jwm046@shsu.edu.

span.strong: 2020-2021 applications must be received by February 1 at 6pm to secure a spot in the lottery.

p.span: We are still accepting New Student Applications for the current 2019-2020 school year. You can find the 2019-2020 Charter School Application HERE. Please submit forms, questions and concerns to Joseph Mesa at jwm046@shsu.edu.

strong.span: We have openings at the following locations:

p.span: Greengate Academy (Klein area) – Kindergarten, 1st, 2nd and 3rd grades
Cypress Trails (Spring area) – Kindergarten, 1st, 2nd, 3rd and 4th grades

In 2019, the Sam Houston State University Charter School received a district rating of a "B" from the Texas Education Agency (TEA), as well as a Distinction for Academic Growth. You may view our School Report Card here, and you may view our full Texas Academic Report Card (TAPR) here.

span.strong: Congratulations to SHSU Charter School Principal Renee O'Neal. Dr. O'Neal received her educational doctorate in literacy from Sam Houston State University in the fall of 2019. We are so proud, Eat 'Em Up, Kats!

img.style: display: block; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;

table.style: width: 778px; height: 86px; background-color: #ffffff; border-color: #030000; border-width: 2px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;

span.span: To schedule a campus tour, please call the Charter School office at 936-294-3347 or email jwm046@shsu.edu.

table.style: width: 766px; height: 509px; background-color: #ffffff; border-color: #030000; border-width: 2px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;

span.strong: Dr. Knox and Dr. O'Neal: Ambassadors for Sam Houston, the University, and the Charter School

table.style: width: 778px; height: 86px; background-color: #ffffff; border-color: #030000; border-width: 2px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;

p.span: In October of 2017, the Texas Education Agency conducted a site visit at the SHSU Charter School to evaluate progress during its first year of integration. To view the TEA Report, click here.

p.span: Due to the recent changes surrounding the COVID-19 circumstances, the March Board Meeting will be held through a virtual Zoom meeting and open to the public. To connect with audio and video, please select the link below:
To connect through audio only (via phone), please call the following number: 1-346-248-7799
Zoom meeting video recordings will be available on the website following the meeting.
